contextId.information: Here "you" is plural and refers to Gideon and the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: I will rescue you and give you victory

contextId.information: The word "you" is plural and refers to the men of Ephraim. Jephthah is referring to the people of Gilead, including himself, when he says "me." AT: "you did not rescue us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

The word "you" is plural and refers to the men of Ephraim. Jephthah is referring to the people of Gilead, including himself, when he says "me." AT: "Why have you come to fight against us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Why have you come to fight against me

contextId.information: Here the word "you" is plural and refers to the guests at the feast. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: But if you cannot tell me
